div.noscript: Please enable Javascript when viewing video pages.

img.br:
Hello Laurel Families, this is Dr. Larrimore with a very important announcement. Today, Governor Carney announced that students would not be returning to school on May 18 as originally hoped. Due to the continuing COVID-19 health crisis, school buildings will remain closed through the end of this school year.
However, students will continue to engage in remote learning plans that were established by the district. The remote learning plan will be in place through June 4th for seniors and through June 19th for all other students.
More information will be forthcoming next week regarding 3rd and 4th quarter grades and Commencement.
Our Grab n Go food program schedule will continue to operate on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays of each week.
We will also continue to work on finalizing our plans to finish out the school year and we will communicate these plans in a timely manner.
Please Stay Safe, Socially Distance Yourselves, And Flatten the Curve.
Shawn
Shawn Larrimore, Ed.D.
Superintendent

td.a: Attention Laurel Middle School & Laurel High School Wellness Center Members
td.br: The Laurel Middle High School Wellness Center will be available by telephone for counseling and medical consultation for students already registered with the Wellness Center. Students and parents can call the Wellness Center at 302-846-0303, Monday through Friday, 8 AM-3 PM.

img.br: Mike Bradley interviews Dr. Larrimore about how Laurel School District is dealing with the COVID-19 pandemic.

td.a: Grab N Go Cancelled for Monday, April 13

img.br: Due to the tornado watch, the lunch grab n go is cancelled for Monday, April 13. We will resume on Wednesday, April 15.

td.br: The Modified 2019-2020 School Calendar as well as the 2020-2021 School Calendar were approved at the Laurel Board of Education meeting held on 4/9/20.
